item.title: Building Microservices: Designing Fine-Grained Systems - Part I

item.title: Designing Data Intensive Applications Part1
item.description: CH01. Reliable, Scalable, and Maintainable Applications About Data System We can think of any kind of databases, queues, or caches as a data system. Nowadays, these tools are optimized for a variety of different uses, and they no longer neatly fit into their origin categories For example, there are data stores that are also used as message queues (Redis), and there are message queues with database-like durability guarantees (Apache Kafka).
